user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of iov_max_init_:
```c
static void
iov_max_init_ (void)
{
  long res = sysconf (_SC_IOV_MAX);
  if (res >= 0)
    mhd_iov_max_ = (unsigned long) res;
  else
  {
#if defined(IOV_MAX)
    mhd_iov_max_ = IOV_MAX;
#else  /* ! IOV_MAX */
    mhd_iov_max_ = 8; /* Should be the safe limit */
#endif /* ! IOV_MAX */
  }
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
#if defined(IOV_MAX)
    mhd_iov_max_ = IOV_MAX;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Not violated in general: the #if defined(IOV_MAX) branch is conditionally compiled and can be reached in builds where IOV_MAX is defined and at runtime when sysconf() returns a negative value. A violation would arise only if the project/build configuration guarantees that IOV_MAX is always defined (or always undefined), making the opposite alternative (the #else branch) never present in any build — in that case the unused branch in every build would be unreachable and would violate Rule 2.1.
